description: Test your knowledge about fascinating natural phenomena and wonders

questions.question: Which tree lives longest?
questions.story: Methuselah, a Great Basin Bristlecone Pine in California's White Mountains, is over 4,800 years old, making it one of Earth's oldest living organisms.

questions.question: Which cave glows brightest?
questions.story: New Zealand's Waitomo Caves host thousands of bioluminescent glowworms that create a natural starry ceiling, attracting visitors from around the world.

questions.question: Which flower blooms fastest?
questions.story: The Talipot Palm flowers only once after 30-80 years of growth, producing the largest flowering structure in the plant kingdom within weeks.

questions.question: Which crystal grows largest?
questions.story: Mexico's Cave of Crystals contains the world's largest known natural crystals, with selenite beams up to 39 feet long and weighing 55 tons.

questions.question: Which waterfall flows pink?
questions.story: Antarctica's Blood Falls flows red due to iron-rich saltwater from an ancient underground lake, creating a striking contrast against the white glacier.
